alert.note: Alert for Aguila Valley; Central La Paz (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 23 at 12:43PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central La Paz and Maricopa Counties through 130 PM MST... At 1242 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Salome, or 32 miles south of Alamo Lake. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs, blow around unsecured objects, and generate blowing dust. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Salome, Vicksburg, Vicksburg Junction, Wenden, Gladden and Harcuvar. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 48 and 76. AZ Route 72 between mile markers 42 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
